item.title: My first article in Times of India
item.description: While reorganizing my cupboards this new year, I came across an old file of mine containing some newspaper cuttings. A closer look took me almost 14 years down the memory lane. This was my first article published on 22nd May 2006 in the Education Times of the prestigious TImes of India. I was approached to share my experiences on getting into IIT and passing out as a topper of the Computer Science and Engineering Department and this is what I wrote!

item.title: Destiny
item.description:
Was happy to interact with the new batch of MTech students at IIT Kanpur this year. As they look forward to a wonderful experience and training ahead at IIT Kanpur and prepare themselves to deal with the challenges of life, this came for them as a much needed session to put things in perspective. Through this interactive session I touched upon the following:

  • Why are we not as gifted as some of the others?
  • Sometimes why do we not get what we want inspite of putting in a lot of hard work?
  • Is there something called destiny? If yes, then what is the point working hard?
  • Law of Karma and how it affects our destiny
  • Two incorrect understandings about destiny and karma
  • Key to success - the seven wonders of life

item.title: Youth Empowerment
item.description: On 16th February 2016 I was invited by the Principal of S. P. College, Pune, Dr. Dilip Sheth to give a talk on Youth Empowerment to the students who had gathered for a state level camp from 13th Feb to 19th Feb. Below is a letter of gratitude from them.

item.title: Seminars for students in RDU Jabalpur
item.description: I was invited by Prof P. V. Jain of Department of Mathematics and Computer Science of Rani Durgavati University, Jabalpur. Over 2 days I gave two seminars on - E.N.E.R.G.Y - Your Sutra for Positive Thinking - Art of Concentration in the age of Distractions The seminars were very well received by the students and the faculty alike. This event was also covered by a local daily “Jabalpur Patrika”. I was also given a letter of appreciation for the same from the university.
